name: wheat stitch™ turtle

meet the **wheat stitch™ turtle** — a sweet and snuggly amigurumi that’s just brimming with personality! this adorable turtle is worked in the round using the lovely [wheat stitch][2] to give its shell that extra bit of texture and style. we’ll start by crocheting the head and four flappy little fins, then set them aside while we create the standout shell. once that’s ready, it all comes together with no sewing required — just a bit of clever crochet! finally, we’ll finish the underside, add a little stuffing, and give your new shelled friend its final fluff.

one of the great things about crocheting amigurumi is the freedom to experiment with any yarn you love — from fingering weight to bulky! simply adjust your hook size to match your yarn choice, and have fun creating all kinds of sea friends!

a video tutorial is included with this pattern.

crochet hook: 
[g (4.0mm) - or size to meet gauge][3]

notions:
[removable stitch markers][4] 
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5] 
[scissors][6]
[fiberfill][7]
[safety eyes][8]
[string for tags][9]

yarn:
[herrschners my ami][10]
55% acrylic/45% cotton blend 
120yds/50g

yarn quantities
linen (tan): 50
clover (green): 65 yds

yarn substitutes
[brava worsted][11]
100% premium acrylic, 218yds/100g

[herrschners worsted 8][12]
100% acrylic, 489yds/226g

[dishie][13]
100% cotton, 190yds/100g

abbreviations:
ch - chain
blo- back loop only
flo - front loop only
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sc2tog - single crochet two together
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong sider

gauge:
not critical for this design.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][14]

sizes:
one size
2” x 6.5”

skill level:
advanced beginner
